refnamediv.refpurpose: Import existing plaintext log files into syslog-ng secure logging environment

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The slogimport is used to import plaintext log file into an existing secure logging environment. Using this utility, log files obtained from a previous installation of syslog-ng or another logging system can be transfered to a secure logging environment. The order of the log entries is preserved. Importing plaintext log files into an existing secure logging environment, required the current encryption key to be supplied in order to preserve consistency.
General call sequence: slogimport -k <key file> -m <MAC file> <new key file> <new MAC file> <plain text log> <output file> [counter]

listitem.para: The file that will contain the new current encryption key after successful import.
The file receiving the new current message authentication code (MAC) of the secure encrypted destination after import. In case an existing file is supplied, new entries will be appended.
The plaintext log file that will be import into the secure logging environment.
The file that will contain the encrypted log entries from the supplied plaintext log file after import.
The current log entry counter of the secure encrypted destination after import. This is required if the log entries to be imported will be appended to an existing secure encrypted destination.
The current host key from the system where the import shall be performed.
The current MAC file from the system where the import shall be performed.

note.para: For the detailed documentation of see The syslog-ng Administrator Guide
If you experience any problems or need help with syslog-ng, visit the syslog-ng mailing list.
For news and notifications about of syslog-ng, visit the syslog-ng blogs.
For specific information requests related to secure logging send a mail to the Airbus Secure Logging Team <secure-logging@airbus.com>.

refsection.title: Author
refsection.para: This manual page was written by the Airbus Secure Logging Team <secure-logging@airbus.com>.
